author: George Chabal
comment: Liked the app, but after updates using way to much battery life on phone even when not on watch. It even restarted itself when I forced stopped it to control phone battery drain. I will not use any app that uses battery life while not in use. I am uninstalling this watch face until they can get the useless battery drain solved. I use more than one watch face that I change every so often. It's the one of the great things about this watch.

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content:
Thanks for this valuable battery performance hint. I'll investigate in this regard so the app will not run when not used on watch.
On the other hand - why having an app installed when you don't use it? ;-)

author: James Scherber
comment: Needs; 1. International Timezone Widget 2. Battery Power Widget 3. Missed calls/Unread SMS/Google Steps Widget. Most elegant watchface in the playstore. I look forward to supporting further. Update: red line IS battery indicator. Nice!
title: Abandonware :( no updates in over a year.

author: Henry F. Ruiz
comment: Loved this on my first gen moto but after updates mentioned by others and now using on moto 2nd gen the parallax watchface no longer works only the time and battery indicator shows up.
title: Parallax Effect needed update!

author: Sivan Koren
comment: Was good, but for the last few Android Wear updates, the parallax effect doesn't work on 1st gen Moto 360. Would love a fix. Works until the watch goes to sleep, then freezes.
title: Parallax not working

author: Ciprian Iordan
comment: Set this watch face with the weather extension over 6 months ago and never felt the need to change it. Had some minor issues with the weather addon but those were fixed fast.
title: One of the best watch faces around

author: Jason Griffin
comment: This is almost perfect. I love having weather on my watch face with a digital clock and the date. The effects are quite unique and cool. I wish I could get rid of the red line in ambient mode, and I wish the weather would show in ambient mode as well. These two additions or options controlling these features would be great. Thanks for the awesome face. Overall I think it could be more feature rich.
title: One of the best watch faces...almost.

author: Adam Weissman
comment: I like the effect of this watch face but while active,  screwed up charging my Moto 360.  Once I switched to another face, issue resolved.
title: Cool Face but caused charging problem

author: Jeremiah Tan
comment: You guys are so creative! Amazing design! Finally found one that is simple with all the necessary feature I wanted like the date, battery life and Time. The time is also big enough to be seen. And the sleep mode looks great as well. Don't actually have to wake your watch. It is pleasant to look at even at sleep mode.
title: Stunning watch face.

author: Keith kowalski
comment: No i dont want to download your other app
title: Spams your phone

author: Kevin Kint
comment: I have a moto 360.2, that always had around 50-55% battery at the end of the day.  With this watch face running (with the weather widget) it's dead before I can even get home. Beware, fierce battery killer.
title: Really Good looking watch face, until your watch dies.

author: Steve Williams
comment: Looks good on square or round watch. My only complaint is the weather location is sometimes not correct.

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content:
Thanks for your review. The weather location is the most current location around your position. But I'll change the displayed location to the real one so it will no more confuse users.
Anyway - enjoy the watch face!

title: Nice watch face

author: Michael Gregov
comment: Notifications do not show unless I touch the watch face.  Is this a bug or by design?  Other than that it is a very nice watch face.
title: Could use a little work.

author: Brett Bynes
comment: Thank you for the response. I appreciate you clearing up the misunderstanding. The parallax effect is unique, and quite stunning.

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: You're welcome. Great to see you like it.

title: Great face.

author: Cruz R.
comment: This watch app on the 360 doesn't even work. After installing it won't charge. It stays at low percent and the watch gets hot. Major Fail!!!
title: WTF...

author: Jay Carnes
comment: Pretty watch face, but no mention that that the weather add-on is extra purchase.
title: Cost $ for widget addon

author: Harv Simmons
comment: this watch face prevented my watch from fully charging and when I wore it the battery drained in 3 hours!
title: BATTERY KILLER!

author: Burning Herman
comment: Is there an option to set your own pic as background?
title: Needs customisation capability

author: Carl Graser
comment: Ugly looking and displays no weather info

author: Christopher Cross
comment: Cannot recommend. For this reason. The IAP is in the settings. I noticed it. Don't bother me.
title: Pushes for in app purchases to notifications.

author: Paddy Nutley
comment: The app won't allow me to turn off the parallax and I hate that it's there.
title: Love this design but...

author: Dave Waddling
comment: Pretty good but not that great without buying the weather widget.
title: OK I guess

author: Dean Vermond
comment: Looks really nice but the battery percentage disappears immediately after the display comes on.

author: DIESEL POWER
comment: Beautiful design
title: Nice and easy to read!!

author: Ursula Fogle
comment: Drains the battery too fast.

author: derek lee
comment: The effects are awesome and it follows pretty well with the accelerometers
title: Cool

author: Mike Johnston
comment: looks really nice on LG R watch the effect is cool

author: Charles H Boykins
comment: Outstanding!!! Nothing more to add.
title: Gadget Particular Consumer

author: Tyler St. Cloud
comment: Nice! Make more add-ons

author: Nasser Alsadoon
comment: Thanks
title: Nasser

author: juozas k.
comment: Works good

author: Antonio Pegorelli

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: Thanks. I develop and use it on LG G Watch R :-)

title: Great watchface! Looks gorgeous on LG watch R

author: Meowstic Quixote
comment: The widget, nobody wants to install it. So it shouldn't be harassing my battery life by constantly lighting my watch up about it. There's no setting to silence it. Battery life gets DEVOURED with this installed. "Looks nice", but battery drain is a serious issue here.

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: It's enough to click on the notification. It's supposed to appear when watch gets connected (or reconnected). I'm about to fix this behavior, but until this happens, just click on it. It just opens the settings screen and it will never appear again until new widget arrives.

title: Annoying widget spam

author: Michael Palsson
comment: This is actually a beautiful watch face. My only complaint is that I have received on the order of a dozen notifications that the face can "also utilize new widgets", which are apparently limited to a weather display, and for which an additional fee is required. I have responded to the notification each time, but it continues to pop up, and will apparently not be satisfied with "no thanks". In fact the widget purchase screen has only one option - "install". This likely to be uninstalled.

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: Sorry to hear that. The notification should never appear again once you click on it. But apparently, there's something wrong in your case. Please, give me a chance to make the notification not so annoying so you keep the watch face.

title: Nice face, very annoying upsell

author: Alvester Garnett
comment: I used to like this watch face but every time I turn the phone back on a notification pops up saying it supports some kind of weather widget that needs to be installed. The trick is the widget is not free but you only find that out once you you click "Install" from the widget invite screen. I'm uninstalling the base app to not have to deal with this nagware anymore.

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: It's enough to click on the notification. It's supposed to appear when watch gets connected (or reconnected). I'm about to fix this behavior, but until this happens, just click on it. It just opens the settings screen and it will never appear again until new widget arrives.

title: Very nice watch face but keeps asking to install widget

author: josiph welton
comment: Doesn't even work. Recurring notification to buy new feature is annoying and possibly against Play Store rules. Reported

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content:
It's enough to click on the notification. It's supposed to appear when watch gets connected (or reconnected). I'm about to fix this behavior, but until this happens, just click on it. It just opens the settings screen and it will never appear again until new widget arrives.
BTW: No such rule exists ;)

title: Force closes

author: Kyle MacDiarmada
comment: All problems fixed 5/5 app!! Also thanks for the free app!

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: Thank you. I'll rethink the notifications so they're not getting displayed each time the watch reconnects.

title: Love the watch face

author: james
comment: Looks fine, annoyed by popups

reply.author: Tomáš Kletzander
reply.content: Hi, its enough to open the notification once and it never comes back until there's new one. Which would be when new widget is available, not sooner.

author: Anthony Zachman
comment: Hi Drew.  Text me when you see this.
title: Hi drew

author: Seng Liang Ng
comment: Nice look. Widget is work in progress.  Perhaps a widget of call logs?
title: Nice look. Widget is a Work in Progress

author: Richard Martin Kelsey
comment: Rubbish - Uninstalled
